title: Download CRAMs from iRODS to lustre

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

run_mode.description: Choose between csv_samples_id(file of iRODS paths),study_id(one or more iRODS study_ids)

samples_to_process.description: Number of files to process (-1 means, all of them)

run_imeta_study.description: Set to true if run_mode is study_id otherwise set to false

input_studies.description: one or more study_ids to get CRAM files, will fail if multiple CRAMS per sample

input_samples_csv.description: TSV with samples and iRODS path, required for csv_samples_id mode, otherwise leave as default, which shows format

input_samples_csv_column.description: column header label with sample name

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths.

cram_output_dir.description: The directory where the CRAM files will be copied, from the work directory. You have to use absolute paths

reportdir.description: The directory where the pipeline reports will be saved. You have to use absolute paths

singularity_use_pre_cached_images.description: Decide to use or not cached images
